pull.title: docs: Get more info about GUI-related issue on Linux
pull.body:
There is bunch of combinations Linux Distro (Debian, Fedora, Ubuntu etc) + Desktop Environment (GNOME, KDE, Xfce etc) + Graphical Shell (Unity, GNOME Shell etc).

This PR adds related requests to the issue template. Providing such data will make GUI-related issue reviewing and reproducing easier.

tree 48c695bda3f7c733921a587e6a8c8bb1b2a81ce5

Get more info about GUI-related issue on Linux

events.message: Get more info about GUI-related issue on Linux

events.body:
Yes, having this information can't hurt in any case and this might save a roundtrip asking.
ACK

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,5 +17,7 @@ If the node is "stuck" during sync or giving "block checksum mismatch" errors, p
 
 <!-- What type of machine are you observing the error on (OS/CPU and disk type)? -->
 
+<!-- For the GUI-related issue on Linux provide names and versions of a distro, a desktop environment and a graphical shell. -->
comments.body: What is a graphical shell? Maybe this should be and/or?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,5 +17,7 @@ If the node is "stuck" during sync or giving "block checksum mismatch" errors, p
 
 <!-- What type of machine are you observing the error on (OS/CPU and disk type)? -->
 
+<!-- For the GUI-related issue on Linux provide names and versions of a distro, a desktop environment and a graphical shell. -->
comments.body:
> What is a graphical shell?

For example:
- before Ubuntu 18.04 [Unity (user interface)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unity_(user_interface)):
> Unity is a graphical shell for the GNOME desktop environment ... 

- [GNOME Shell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GNOME_Shell):
> GNOME Shell is the graphical shell of the GNOME desktop environment starting with version 3.

Agree that a graphical shell cannot be specified in each case.
Sure, the wording should be better. Maybe "_... and a graphical shell (if relevant)._"?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,5 +17,7 @@ If the node is "stuck" during sync or giving "block checksum mismatch" errors, p
 
 <!-- What type of machine are you observing the error on (OS/CPU and disk type)? -->
 
+<!-- For the GUI-related issue on Linux provide names and versions of a distro, a desktop environment and a graphical shell. -->
comments.body:
Clarifying here won't explain it to someone submitting an issue. The comment itself needs to be clearer.

Perhaps "graphical shell" is a familiar term for GNOME users, but most KDE users will never encounter it, since almost all use Plasma+KWin.

"*(if relevant)*" sounds good enough.
